newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek cash rates in holding pattern in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Greek cash rates in holding pattern in late trade.

text.p: Greek depos and forex forwards were fluctuating narrowly in late unexciting dealing and ecu/drachma eased after the central bank's fixing where players bought 80 million ecus, dealers said.
"Depos and forex forwards are steady in late dealing," a money dealer at a foreign bank said. "Ecu/drachma eased after the fixing where 80 million ecus were bought by banks."
Drachma liquidity is tight and traces forex developments, the dealer said.

"The central bank tries to dissuade banks from going long ecu, short drachma by keeping the ecu/drachma stable which negates the interest rate differential," he said. "The Bank of Greece knows that drachma liquidity is tight and tries to help that way."
The Bank of Greece drained overnight liquidity at 12.40 percent.
All late polls showed the two major parties, the conservatives and the socialists, tied in first place with smaller parties holding on to gains recorded in earlier polls.
The crucial debate between Prime Minister Costas Simitis and conservative leader Miltiadis Evert is going to take place tonight.
Early elections will be held September 22 but the market has taken a positive attitude towards them on the ground that the winner will have no option but to follow Greece's EU convergence plan.
The mark was quoted at 159.20/30 drachmas from Friday's 159.320 fix, the dollar at 240.69/79 drachmas from 240.940 and the Ecu at 301.16/20 from 301.500 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
